overview: From 2025-10-26 to 2025-11-02, ethereum-optimism/specs had 14 new PRs (9 merged), 0 new issues, and 33 active contributors.

topPRs.title: docs(specs/experimental/contracts): create L2StandardBridge specification
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
# docs(specs/experimental/contracts): create L2StandardBridge specification

## Summary

This PR adds a comprehensive specification for the L2StandardBridge contract, which enables ETH and ERC20 token transfers between L1 and L2. The specification follows the canonical format used for other bridge contracts in the experimental/contracts directory.

**Key components:**
- **Overview**: High-level description of the bridge's role
- **Definitions**: OptimismMintableERC20 and Native L2 Token concepts
- **Assumptions**: Three trust assumptions (L1StandardBridge, L2CrossDomainMessenger, token implementations)
- **Invariants**: Three critical security properties focused on liveness and custody
  - Users receive assets on L2 when depositing from L1
  - Users can claim assets on L1 when withdrawing from L2
  - One-to-one custody across chains (no double-minting or draining)
- **Function Specification**: Complete documentation of all 14 public/external functions (excluding version())

The spec documents the intended behavior based on the StandardBridge.sol parent contract and L2StandardBridge.sol implementation.

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] **Verify invariants accurately reflect security properties**: Check that the three invariants (cross-chain liveness and 1:1 custody) are the most critical properties for this bridge contract and appropriately span multiple functions
- [ ] **Cross-reference function specifications with actual contract code**: Spot-check 3-5 functions (especially finalizeBridgeETH, finalizeBridgeERC20, and withdraw) to ensure the MUST/MUST NOT statements match the actual Solidity implementation
- [ ] **Validate assumptions are true dependencies**: Confirm that the three assumptions (trusted L1StandardBridge, trusted L2CrossDomainMessenger, correct token implementation) are actually required for the contract to function correctly

### Notes

- All linting checks passed (markdown formatting, TOC generation, spelling)
- The specification format matches the existing L2ERC721Bridge spec for consistency
- Legacy functions (withdraw, withdrawTo, MESSENGER, OTHER_BRIDGE) are included for completeness
- The spec intentionally excludes the `version()` function per guidelines

**Session**: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/def7608367e94759b17419372a3d08dd  
**Requested by**: Ariel Diaz (ariel@oplabs.co) / @aliersh

topPRs.title: Create DisputeGameFactory specification
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
# Create DisputeGameFactory specification

## Summary

This PR adds a comprehensive specification for the `DisputeGameFactory` contract, which serves as the central registry and factory for creating dispute game contracts in the OP Stack fault proof system. The specification follows the canonical OP Stack format with Overview, Definitions, Assumptions, Invariants, and Function Specification sections.

**Key additions:**
- 4 definitions: Game UUID, Game Implementation, Initialization Bond, Game Clone
- 2 assumptions about owner governance and implementation validity
- 2 invariants: game uniqueness enforcement and registry consistency
- Complete function specifications for all 11 public/external functions (excluding `version()`)

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] **Validate invariant selection** - I identified only 2 invariants. Per spec guidelines, are these the right ones? Should there be more? Specifically:
  - Is "game uniqueness" (iDGF-001) truly a cross-function property, or just a single-function check that belongs in the `create` function spec?
  - Is "registry consistency" (iDGF-002) appropriately scoped?
- [ ] **Verify severity ratings** - I assigned High to game uniqueness and Medium to registry consistency. Do these align with OP Stack's risk framework?
- [ ] **Check technical accuracy** - Review the `create` function specification (lines 186-210) to ensure my description of the CWIA clone creation flow matches the actual implementation
- [ ] **Confirm completeness** - Are there any important cross-function properties or behaviors I missed? Compare against the actual contract at `packages/contracts-bedrock/src/dispute/DisputeGameFactory.sol`

### Notes

- All linting checks pass (markdown, TOC, spelling, filenames)
- This is a new spec, not an improvement of an existing one - only the interface was previously documented
- The spec is placed in `experimental/contracts/dispute/` per the file location guidelines

**Session**: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/fd12b322e1a64d41b5d6dc69bf779257  
**Requested by**: Ariel Diaz (ariel@oplabs.co) - @aliersh

topPRs.title: docs(specs/experimental/contracts): create GasPriceOracle specification
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
# docs(specs/experimental/contracts): create GasPriceOracle specification

## Summary

This PR adds a comprehensive specification for the `GasPriceOracle` L2 predeploy contract (address `0x420000000000000000000000000000000000000F`). The GasPriceOracle provides an API for estimating the L1 data availability portion of L2 transaction fees, with different calculation formulas across network upgrades (Bedrock, Ecotone, Fjord, Isthmus, Jovian).

**Key sections:**
- **Definitions**: L1 Data Fee, Fork Activation, Compressed Transaction Size
- **Assumptions**: Dependencies on L1Block predeploy for fee parameters and depositor account for fork activation
- **Invariants**: Fork activation sequence enforcement and irreversibility
- **Function Specification**: All 17 public/external functions (excluding `version()`)

The specification follows the canonical format for OP Stack contract specs and passes all linting checks (markdown, TOC, spelling).

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] **Verify function behaviors match contract implementation** - Cross-check each function specification against `packages/contracts-bedrock/src/L2/GasPriceOracle.sol`, especially the fee calculation formulas in `getL1Fee`, `getL1FeeUpperBound`, and `getOperatorFee`
- [ ] **Validate fork activation sequence** - Confirm that Ecotone → Fjord → Isthmus → Jovian is the correct order by checking the actual require statements in set* functions
- [ ] **Review invariant appropriateness** - Determine if the two invariants about fork activation (sequence and irreversibility) are critical enough to be invariants or if they're implementation details that should be in function specs instead
- [ ] **Verify assumptions** - Confirm that L1Block does provide the listed parameters and that the depositor account trust assumption is accurate

### Notes

- This is the first spec for GasPriceOracle - no existing spec was found in the repository
- The contract is read-only (view functions) except for fork activation functions
- Excluded `version()` function from specification per guidelines (standard ISemver interface)
- All three linting checks passed (markdown, TOC generation, spelling)

**Devin Session:** https://app.devin.ai/sessions/830de4d1f72f4ca89e761c824fefef88  
**Requested by:** Ariel Diaz (ariel@oplabs.co) / @aliersh

topPRs.title: docs(specs/experimental/contracts): create LivenessModule specification
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
# docs(specs/experimental/contracts): create LivenessModule specification

## Summary

Created a comprehensive specification for the `LivenessModule` contract following the canonical OP Stack specification format. The LivenessModule enables permissionless removal of inactive Safe owners based on liveness data from the LivenessGuard, with a shutdown mechanism that transfers ownership to a fallback owner when the owner count falls too low.

**Key sections:**
- **Definitions**: 5 core concepts (Liveness Interval, Minimum Owners, Threshold Percentage, Fallback Owner, Shutdown)
- **Assumptions**: 2 external dependencies (LivenessGuard accuracy, fallback owner trusted)
- **Invariants**: 4 high-level security properties (threshold maintenance, live owner protection, non-live owner removal, shutdown triggering)
- **Function Specification**: All 10 public/external functions documented (constructor + 9 functions; version() excluded per guidelines)

**Changes from initial draft:**
- Simplified assumption a02-002 from "governance-controlled" to "trusted" per feedback
- Refocused invariants on higher-level properties rather than implementation details per feedback

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] **CRITICAL: Verify spec matches contract implementation** - Cross-reference the spec against `packages/contracts-bedrock/src/safe/LivenessModule.sol`, especially:
  - The `removeOwners` function behavior and its shutdown transition logic
  - The `_verifyFinalState` checks and what they enforce
  - The threshold calculation formula in `getRequiredThreshold`
- [ ] **Validate invariants are truly cross-function** - Ensure the 4 invariants span multiple functions and aren't just documenting single-function access control or parameter validation (per strict spec guidelines)
- [ ] **Check shutdown mechanism accuracy** - The spec describes how the module transitions from normal removal mode to shutdown mode when owner count drops below MIN_OWNERS. Verify this matches `_removeOwner`, `_swapToFallbackOwnerSafeCall`, and the for-loop logic in `removeOwners`
- [ ] **Verify assumptions are actual dependencies** - Confirm the 2 assumptions (LivenessGuard accuracy, fallback owner trust) are truly external dependencies required for the contract to function correctly

### Notes

This specification was created from scratch (no existing LivenessModule spec existed in the specs repo, only a high-level description in `safe-extensions.md`). The spec is placed in `/specs/experimental/contracts/safe/` to match the contract location and follows the kebab-case naming convention.

All linting checks pass (markdown format, TOC, spelling, filenames). CI checks pass.

**Devin session**: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/9a519cdc0bee44f4a984dcbbf3fa051c  
**Requested by**: Ariel Diaz (ariel@oplabs.co) / @aliersh

Last update: 2025-10-24 16:19 ET

topPRs.title: docs(specs/experimental/contracts): create L2CrossDomainMessenger specification
topPRs.author: devin-ai-integration
topPRs.body:
# docs(specs/experimental/contracts): create L2CrossDomainMessenger specification

## Summary

This PR creates a comprehensive specification for the L2CrossDomainMessenger predeploy contract, which provides the high-level interface for cross-chain message passing between L2 and L1. The specification follows the canonical format with sections for Overview, Definitions, Assumptions, Invariants, and Function Specifications.

**Key sections added:**
- **4 Definitions**: Message Hash, Message Nonce, Address Aliasing, and Failed Message
- **2 Assumptions**: Trust relationships with L1CrossDomainMessenger and L2ToL1MessagePasser
- **4 Invariants**: Message replay protection (Critical), Failed message replay capability (High), Message nonce monotonicity (High), and Cross-chain message authentication (Critical)
- **10 Function Specifications**: Complete coverage of all public/external functions including the complex `relayMessage` function

## Review & Testing Checklist for Human

- [ ] **Verify invariants are truly cross-function properties**: Review i01-001 through i01-004 to ensure they represent non-obvious behavioral properties spanning multiple functions, not just single-function checks. Pay special attention to i01-004 (authentication) - is this a true invariant or just relayMessage behavior?
- [ ] **Cross-check relayMessage specification accuracy**: The relayMessage function has complex branching logic with many edge cases (version checks, replay detection, reentrancy protection, gas checks). Verify the specification matches the actual contract implementation in `/optimism/packages/contracts-bedrock/src/L2/L2CrossDomainMessenger.sol` and the base `CrossDomainMessenger.sol`.
- [ ] **Validate assumptions are necessary dependencies**: Confirm the two assumptions (a01-001 and a01-002) represent actual external dependencies the contract relies on, not just contextual information.
- [ ] **Review completeness against base contract**: Since L2CrossDomainMessenger inherits from CrossDomainMessenger, verify all inherited public functions are properly documented and no critical behaviors were missed.

### Test Plan
1. Compare the specification against the actual contract source code line-by-line for accuracy
2. Verify all linting checks pass (already confirmed in development)
3. Build the mdbook to ensure the specification renders correctly: `cd ~/repos/specs && mdbook build`

### Notes
- Specification created from contract at: `/optimism/packages/contracts-bedrock/src/L2/L2CrossDomainMessenger.sol`
- Also analyzed the base `CrossDomainMessenger` contract to understand full functionality
- All linting checks passed: markdown formatting, TOC generation, spelling, and filename validation
- Link to Devin run: https://app.devin.ai/sessions/6cce1e2074cf421eb6145155c3ed162d
- Requested by: Ariel Diaz (ariel@oplabs.co) / @aliersh

completedItems.title: jovian: Add DA footprint receipt fields
completedItems.body:
**Description**

Jovian adds a new receipt field `daFootprintGasScalar` and sets the `blobGasUsed` field to the tx DA footprint.

op-geth implementation: https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/op-geth/pull/710
